channel.title: Net Hugging Hardware and Software (via bkil-bot)

item.title: Re: Desktop software to view observations ?: You can also turn on Settings > Map Settings > Log routes for execution, and then use the Database > Saved Routes screen to export GPX to export files that can be viewed in a variety of GPX apps on the desktop. -pejacoby

Re: Has anyone run WiGLE inside the windows 11 android subsystem?: I was afraid of that. Thanks for responding. slope gameIt's the first time I've tried to launch WiGLE within the Windows 11 Android emulation layer. -achooibm

Re: How to delete wigle data collected in certain time frame: Assuming you mean data stored on your local phone/device, you can erase all data on the "Database" item in the 3-horizontal-lines "hamburger" menu. On the "Database" screen scroll to the bottom and you can click "CLEAR DB" to erase all locally-stored data. If you want to be more surgical and really just remove a certain timeframe you would need to export the local sqlite database the app is using, either with android development tools or the "BACKUP DATABASE" button on the "Database" screen. Then use an sqlite database editor to remove the records you no longer want, and then put that file back on your device with android development tools. -bobzilla

Re: Desktop software to view observations ?: That's not what you asked but here is a solution to your problem. I have made a simple python script that convert a wigle csv file to a kml or gpx file. Then, you can use google maps to visualize the resulting kml file, or any gpx viewer like gpxsee to visualize the resulting gpx file. -zebul666
How to delete wigle data collected in certain time frame: title -R5ph4
Re: Should I merge database from different phones or keep them seperate ?: merging databases will slow performance - bigger databases are slower. -arkasha
Re: What is "Maxout DB Marker" in Android App ?: it sets the last-uploaded marker to the end of the list - you can use this to skip uploading things in your database -arkasha

Re: Pwnagotchi plugin: Sorry - we're not the maintainers of the pwnagotchi - you'll have to use the information on your device and in their source repository to debug. By all means, please post findings here! -arkasha

Re: Pwnagotchi plugin: I would imagine the same advice as above applies - check your uploads page and see if the pwnagotchi is sending files (correlate it with the logs on your pwnagotchi).As i said everything shows it being sent but nothing in my uploads. -wpa3
Re: Pwnagotchi plugin: I would imagine the same advice as above applies - check your uploads page and see if the pwnagotchi is sending files (correlate it with the logs on your pwnagotchi). -arkasha

Re: Pwnagotchi plugin: looking at https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotch ... gle.py#L84, it looks like it expects the "Encoded for use" value from your https://wigle.net/account page This is probably uploading anonymously by default.Thats a shame i have since changed to the Encoded for use value is there anyway to check things are getting uploaded then? I guess it would be better to change the value in the script. -wpa3

Re: Pwnagotchi plugin: looking at https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotch ... gle.py#L84, it looks like it expects the "Encoded for use" value from your https://wigle.net/account page This is probably uploading anonymously by default. -arkasha

Re: Pwnagotchi plugin: Assuming you configured your credentials, just check the uploads page! -arkIt only asks for these Code: main.plugins.wigle.enabled = truemain.plugins.wigle.api_key = "RANDOM API KEY"main.plugins.wigle.whitelist = []But nothing was aadded so unsure whats happening honesty. -wpa3

Should I merge database from different phones or keep them seperate ?: Different phones have different antennas and record different signal level for same location. If somehow I figure out on one device -Xdb is Ym away. Keeping database separate will help ? Is there a way to import database from different phone and mark it's origin. -R5ph4
What is "Maxout DB Marker" in Android App ?: "Maxout DB Marker" -R5ph4
